c545f790-e1fb-4206-b38f-19d860167ec7.description: Earners of this badge are members of the National Honor Society (NHS), the nation’s premier organization established to recognize outstanding high school students. These individuals have met their school's qualifications for membership, based on the four pillars of NHS: scholarship, service, leadership, and character. NHS was established in 1921 by the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
c545f790-e1fb-4206-b38f-19d860167ec7.name: National Honor Society Member

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Must be inducted into a local chapter of the National Honor Society.
Must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 85, B, 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, or equivalent standard of excellence. Each school chapter is allowed to require a higher cumulative GPA.

87c1db11-e948-4b4c-aa4c-3d46d4e45950.description: Earners of this badge are members of the National Junior Honor Society (NJHS), the nation’s premier organization established to recognize outstanding middle level students. These individuals have met their school's qualifications for membership, based on the five pillars of NJHS: scholarship, service, leadership, characterm and citizenship. NJHS was established in 1929 by the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
87c1db11-e948-4b4c-aa4c-3d46d4e45950.name: National Junior Honor Society Member

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Must be inducted into a local chapter of the National Junior Honor Society.
Must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 85, B, 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, or equivalent standard of excellence. Each school chapter is allowed to require a higher cumulative GPA.

c5ede61b-4b96-499f-9673-2692c80addce.description: Earners of this badge are recipients of the National Honor Society Scholarship. These individuals were chosen by a national selection committee because of their demonstrated commitment to the pillars of NHS: scholarship, service, leadership, and character. Recipients exhibited outstanding academic achievement as well as a service mindset. The scholarship program is supported by the parent organization of NHS, the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
c5ede61b-4b96-499f-9673-2692c80addce.name: National Honor Society Scholarship Recipient

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Must be inducted into a local chapter of the National Honor Society.
Must be a high school senior and member in good standing with a local chapter of the National Honor Society.
Must complete the National Honor Society Scholarship application and be chosen by a national selection committee to be a semi-finalist, finalist, or national winner.

805316d5-fa93-4550-875a-1926eb6e3c95.description: Earners of this badge are recipients of the National Junior Honor Society (NJHS) Outstanding Achievement Award. These individuals were nominated by their advisers and chosen by a national selection committee because of their demonstrated commitment to the pillars of NJHS: scholarship, service, leadership, character, and citizenship. The award program is supported by the parent organization of NJHS, the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
805316d5-fa93-4550-875a-1926eb6e3c95.name: National Junior Honor Society Outstanding Achievement Award Recipient

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Must be inducted into a local chapter of the National Junior Honor Society.
Must complete the National Junior Honor Society Outstanding Achievement Award application and be chosen by a national selection committee as an award recipient.

1012f9f9-dfbb-4899-98c4-259b1f642dba.description: Earners of this badge are members of National Student Council. These individuals possess identifiable leadership qualities and were elected or selected to their school’s student council and fulfill the duties and responsibilities of their positions as reflected in the four tenets of National Student Council: Leadership, Service, Engagement and Student Voice. National Student Council was established in 1931 and is a program of the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
1012f9f9-dfbb-4899-98c4-259b1f642dba.name: National Student Council Member

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be seated as a member or officer of the student council (aka student government, ASB, etc.) in a school that has an active affiliation with National Student Council.

Earners of this badge are active members in good standing, fulfilling the duties and responsibilities of position or office, as confirmed by having an adviser-verified student account with National Student Council.

d9391e37-5a33-4c68-9962-44294195979d.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the rigorous, demonstration-based curriculum of the Distinguished Student Leader Program that is anchored in the four tenets of National Student Council: Leadership, Service, Engagement, and Student Voice. Students also come to understand their own leadership strengths and style. The Distinguished Student Leader program is sponsored by National Student Council, a program of the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
d9391e37-5a33-4c68-9962-44294195979d.name: National Student Council Distinguished Student Leader

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a member of the local student council or have a leadership position in another campus organization in a school that has an active affiliation with National Student Council.
Must keep a record of all required activities in a personal portfolio and present the portfolio to the adviser or leadership instructor for evaluation.
Must secure endorsement of adviser or leadership instructor verifying satisfactory completion of all tasks necessary to be considered for recognition.
Must create an adviser-verified student account and submit an online application including a leadership essay, leadership profile, and endorsement from adviser or leadership instructor.
Must receive a satisfactory evaluation and be found eligible to receive Distinguished Student Leader designation from the NASSP Department of Student Leadership .

bcb1c1b4-b4dd-44d5-9eb0-ed490a3d1ed9.description: Earners of this badge are middle level and high school principals who have been recognized for providing high quality learning opportunities for students as well as demonstrating exemplary contributions to the profession. They represent each of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, and the U.S. Department of State Office of Overseas Schools, and the U.S. Department of Defense Education Activity.
bcb1c1b4-b4dd-44d5-9eb0-ed490a3d1ed9.name: NASSP Principal of the Year

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

alignments.name: Professional Standards for Educational Leaders (PSEL)
alignments.description: The NASSP Principal of the Year Program reflects best practices and is aligned with the Building Ranks framework and the National Policy Board for Educational Administration’s Professional Standards for Educational Leaders (PSEL) and other educational leadership standards.

alignments.name: Building Ranks: A Comprehensive Framework for Effective School Leaders
alignments.description: Building Ranks is a practice-based framework developed by NASSP that is rooted in the two domains of Building Culture and Leading Learning. These two essential domains of school leadership each have discrete dimensions that enable school leaders to support and lead the adults who prepare and nurture students.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge completed a rigorous application and were nominated by their State Principal Association for review by a national selection committee. The selection committee identifies three finalists from among the state recipients for additional consideration and review. Each year, one principal is recognized as the NASSP National Principal of the Year.

Earners are invited to participate in ongoing professional learning focused on building community and relationships within their class and establishing a presence as an online leader to serve principals around the country.
Earners share their professional expertise and experiences with other school leaders and policy makers by blogging, delivering educational sessions at conferences, and online presentations.
Earners must be a NASSP member at time of nomination and maintain membership during year of recognition.

72ea9803-41c8-48c4-896e-2bbf40d53f1c.description: Earners of this badge are middle level and high school assistant principals who have been recognized for providing high quality learning opportunities for students. They are acknowledged by leadership in their states for the contributions they have made to the profession. They represent each of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, the U.S. Department of Defense Education Activity, and the U.S. Department of State Office of Overseas Schools.
72ea9803-41c8-48c4-896e-2bbf40d53f1c.name: NASSP Assistant Principal of the Year

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

alignments.name: Professional Standards for Educational Leaders (PSEL)
alignments.description: The NASSP Assistant Principal of the Year Program reflects best practices and is aligned with the Building Ranks framework and the National Policy Board for Educational Administration’s Professional Standards for Educational Leaders (PSEL) and other educational leadership standards.

alignments.name: Building Ranks: A Comprehensive Framework for Effective School Leaders
alignments.description: Building Ranks is a practice-based framework developed by NASSP that is rooted in the two domains of Building Culture and Leading Learning. These two essential domains of school leadership each have discrete dimensions that enable school leaders to support and lead the adults who prepare and nurture students.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge completed a rigorous application and were nominated by their State Principal Association for review by a national selection committee. The selection committee identifies three finalists from among the state recipients for additional consideration and review. Each year, one assistant principal is recognized as the NASSP National Assistant Principal of the Year.

Earners are invited to participate in ongoing professional learning focused on building community and relationships within their class and establishing a presence as an online leader to serve assistant principals around the country.
Earners share their professional expertise and experiences with other school leaders by blogging, delivering educational sessions at conferences, and online presentations.
Earners must be a NASSP member at time of nomination and maintain membership during year of recognition.

3a790189-88d5-41e7-a343-6c774dbe0b10.description: Earners of this badge were workshop presenters at the 2021 National Student Council Conference. The conference celebrated "Student Leaders Making History" with sessions related to the tenets of National Student Council: Leadership, Service, Engagement, and Student Voice. National Student Council was established in 1931 and is a program of the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
3a790189-88d5-41e7-a343-6c774dbe0b10.name: National Student Council Conference 2021 - Presenter

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be seated as a member or officer of the student council (also known as student government, associated student body, etc.) in a school that has an active affiliation with National Student Council. Earners must also have an adviser-verified student account with National Student Council.

Earners of this badge presented at least one workshop at the 2021 National Student Council Conference. Conference workshops featured topics related to the four tenets of National Student Council: Leadership, Service, Engagement, and Student Voice. See the "evidence" section for details on the workshop topic(s) presented by this earner.

41605f46-4f4a-482c-aadd-d94966cb8fbb.description: Earners of this badge are student members of National Student Council who successfully completed 8 hours of leadership training during the 2021 National Student Council Conference. The conference celebrated "Student Leaders Making History" with sessions related to the tenets of National Student Council: Leadership, Service, Engagement, and Student Voice. National Student Council was established in 1931 and is a program of the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
41605f46-4f4a-482c-aadd-d94966cb8fbb.name: National Student Council Conference 2021 - Student Leader

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be seated as a member or officer of the student council (also known as student government, associated student body, etc.) in a school that has an active affiliation with National Student Council, as evidenced by an adviser-verified student account with National Student Council.

Earners of this badge attended the 2021 National Student Council Conference. These individuals participated in the required number of conference sessions, which featured topics related to the four tenets of National Student Council: Leadership, Service, Engagement, and Student Voice.

Earners of this badge must submit written takeaways and reflections for each of the following components of the National Student Council Conference: four (4) conference keynote speakers; four (4) conference workshops; two (2) Meet-the-Pro presentations; (2) Idea Share sessions; and networking sessions, all of which are subject to approval by National Student Council.

Earners of this badge must submit written proposals on how to turn their experiences and ideas during the National Student Council Conference into action at their schools, including: one (1) best idea or strategy to introduce and use with their student council; one (1) best idea or strategy to present to their principal and adviser for consideration; and one (1) best idea or strategy to use for personal leadership development, all of which are subject to approval by National Student Council.

eca40ded-9867-44a4-bd36-05acb45cb86c.description: Earners of this badge are NASSP school leader members who facilitate collaborative spaces to share similar lived experiences, passions, and interests with their peers. Facilitators ensure that NASSP Leadership Network programming, engagement, and communications are centered on the motivations, preferences, and needs of participants (fellow school leaders).
eca40ded-9867-44a4-bd36-05acb45cb86c.name: Leadership Network Facilitator

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge are responsible for acting as the point of contact between the Leadership Network and a NASSP staff liaison. During each calendar year, facilitators participate in a two-hour facilitator onboarding training and four one-hour quarterly facilitator network meetings/trainings with NASSP staff and other Leadership Network facilitators.

Earners of this badge are responsible for establishing meeting times, developing meeting agendas and objectives, and facilitating meetings for a Leadership Network. Facilitators host one-hour monthly virtual network meetings and commit to at least one hour of planning and preparation in advance of the monthly meeting.
Earners of this badge are responsible for bringing the needs of the school leader member to NASSP and identify content areas to NASSP for programming.
Additionally, facilitators are responsible for the planning, convening, and facilitation of sessions during a two- to three-day in-person annual meeting.

c4f45b8b-c3d2-408d-a1af-021cd104f9a2.description: Earners of this badge are engaged, forward-thinking student leaders and school leaders. The committee is comprised of students, advisers, and principals who have been selected to serve based on demonstrated leadership in their schools and communities. Over a two-year period, committee members collaborate on projects and activities, present at conferences, and meet with various stakeholders. Committee members also select, promote, and advocate for the bi-annual national student initiative.
c4f45b8b-c3d2-408d-a1af-021cd104f9a2.name: NASSP Student Leadership Advisory Committee Member

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Students must be members of student council at a school with an active membership with National Student Council or be members of a local chapter of National Honor Society or National Junior Honor Society. Students are nominated by their State Principals Association or their State Student Council Association before applying for committee membership. Student members are recommended to and approved by the NASSP Board based on their leadership and commitment to their schools and communities.

Advisers must be the adviser for a student council at a school with an active membership with National Student Council or the adviser of a local chapter of National Honor Society or National Junior Honor Society. Advisers are selected based on their demonstrated commitment to and promotion of student voice in their communities. Adviser members are recommended to and approved by the NASSP Board before joining the committee.

Principals must be a member of the National Association of Secondary School Principals and have a student council with an active membership with National Student Council or have a local chapter of National Honor Society or National Junior Honor Society. Principals are selected based on their demonstrated commitment to and promotion of student voice in their communities. Principal members are recommended to and approved by the NASSP Board before joining the committee.

Committee members are responsible for the selection, implementation, and promotion of the bi-yearly NASSP National Initiative. The National Initiative is a collective effort to raise awareness to an issue or cause affecting students and communities everywhere by empowering student leaders and elevating student voices to enact lasting change.

Committee members receive personalized advocacy training from NASSP before meeting with their elected officials in the United States House of Representatives and United States Senate. Committee members advocate for topics specific to their schools, communities, and states. The student members on the committee then prepare an advocacy presentation for student leaders across the United States and U.S. Territories at NASSP's LEAD Conferences.

Committee members are responsible for presenting workshops, emceeing conferences, and participating in panel presentations related to their roles as well as the NASSP National Initiative. Additionally, committee members may occasionally present for or provide information to the NASSP Board of Directors, state or local officials, and local newspapers.

Committee members are responsible for writing and contributing to Advise Magazine, the official publication of the National Honor Society, National Junior Honor Society, and National Student Council. Committee members may also be asked to provide content for use on social media and contribute to articles in the Principal Leadership magazine or local newspapers.

584d73e9-f015-45d7-bb00-060d17badd41.description: Earners of this badge are middle level and high school principals, including any subset of grades 6–12, who exhibit bold creative leadership in their drive to harness the potential of new technologies for further learning goals.
584d73e9-f015-45d7-bb00-060d17badd41.name: NASSP Digital Principal of the Year

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

alignments.name: Professional Standards for Educational Leaders (PSEL)
alignments.description: The NASSP Digital Principal of the Year Program reflects best practices and is aligned with the Building Ranks framework, International Society for Technology in Education (ISTE) standards, and the National Policy Board for Educational Administration’s Professional Standards for Educational Leaders (PSEL) standards.

alignments.name: ISTE Standards for Education Leaders
alignments.description: ISTE Standards are a framework for innovation in education. These standards target the knowledge and behaviors required for leaders to empower teachers and make student learning possible.

alignments.name: Building Ranks: A Comprehensive Framework for Effective School Leaders
alignments.description: Building Ranks is a practice-based framework developed by NASSP that is rooted in the two domains of Building Culture and Leading Learning. These two essential domains of school leadership each have discrete dimensions that enable school leaders to support and lead the adults who prepare and nurture students.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge completed a rigorous application that was reviewed by a selection committee. The award is based on knowledge, skills, and attitudes to undertake the Building Ranks framework explicated with the ISTE Standards for Education Leaders. From a pool of candidates including principals in schools that cover any subset of grades 6-12, three principals are selected as a NASSP Digital Principal of the Year.
Earners are invited to participate in ongoing professional learning and  serve as online leaders for principals around the country.

Earners share their professional expertise and experiences with other school leaders and policy makers by blogging, delivering educational sessions at conferences, delivering online presentations, and conducting virtual tours of their schools.
Earners must be a NASSP member at time of candidacy and maintain membership during year of recognition.

79bed8dc-f1d9-4827-863b-61651a737199.description: Earners of this badge are high school student leaders who facilitate collaborative spaces to share similar lived experiences, passions, and interests with their peers. Facilitators ensure that NASSP Leadership Network programming, engagement, and communications are centered on the motivations, preferences, and needs of the student leader participants.
79bed8dc-f1d9-4827-863b-61651a737199.name: Leadership Network Student Facilitator

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge are responsible for acting as the point of contact between the Leadership Network and a NASSP staff liaison. During each calendar year, facilitators participate in a two-hour facilitator onboarding training and four one-hour quarterly facilitator network meetings/trainings with NASSP staff and other Leadership Network facilitators.

Earners of this badge are responsible for establishing meeting times, developing meeting agendas and objectives, and facilitating meetings for a Leadership Network. Facilitators host one-hour monthly virtual network meetings and commit to at least one hour of planning and preparation in advance of the monthly meeting.
Earners of this badge are responsible for bringing the needs of the student leaders to NASSP and identify content areas to NASSP for programming.
Additionally, facilitators are responsible for the planning, convening, and facilitation of sessions during a two- to three-day in-person annual meeting.

c0a903b0-fed2-462d-bc27-43e0f0540fbf.description: Earners of this badge are members of National Student Council and hosts for the 2021 National Student Council Conference. The conference celebrated "Student Leaders Making History" and focused on the four tenets of National Student Council: Leadership, Service, Engagement, and Student Voice. National Student Council was established in 1931 and is a program of the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
c0a903b0-fed2-462d-bc27-43e0f0540fbf.name: National Student Council Conference 2021 - Host

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be seated as a member, officer, or adviser of the student council (also known as student government, associated student body, etc.) in a National Student Council Conference host school that has an active affiliation with National Student Council. Earners must also have an adviser account or adviser-verified student account with National Student Council.

Earners of this badge volunteered time, effort, and expertise to carry out essential assignments and tasks in direct support of the planning, preparation, and execution of the conference. All student earners volunteered a minimum number of hours/days as established by the host adviser/council that supported the preparations and hosting of the National Student Council Conference.

b3946d37-9849-4cdc-95c7-712e939fd8f0.description: Earners of this badge are National Student Council advisers who successfully completed 8 hours of leadership training during the 2021 National Student Council Conference. The conference celebrated "Student Leaders Making History" with sessions related to the tenets of National Student Council: Leadership, Service, Engagement, and Student Voice. National Student Council was established in 1931 and is a program of the National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP).
b3946d37-9849-4cdc-95c7-712e939fd8f0.name: National Student Council Conference 2021 - Adviser Leader

issuer.summary: issued by National Association of Secondary School Principals

entity.name: National Association of Secondary School Principals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be the student council (also known as student government, associated student body, etc.) adviser in a school that has an active affiliation with National Student Council.

Earners of this badge attended the 2021 National Student Council Conference. These individuals participated in the required number of conference sessions, which featured topics related to the four tenets of National Student Council: Leadership, Service, Engagement, and Student Voice.

Earners of this badge must submit written takeaways and reflections for each of the following components of the National Student Council Conference: four (4) conference keynote speakers; four (4) conference workshops; two (2) Meet-the-Pro presentations; (2) Idea Share sessions; and networking sessions, all of which are subject to approval by National Student Council.

Earners of this badge must submit written proposals on how to turn their experiences and ideas during the National Student Council Conference into action at their schools, including: one (1) best idea or strategy to introduce and use with their student council; one (1) best idea or strategy to share with an administrator for potential implementation; and one (1) best idea or strategy to use for personal leadership development, all of which are subject to approval by National Student Council.
